content.description:
Snapdragons are a type of flowering plant. The flower color of the plants is determined by a single gene with two alleles: an incompletely dominant <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></math> allele and a recessive <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></math> allele. Researchers established a new population of snapdragon plants that they hypothesize will be in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium. At the start of the study, the researchers randomly picked <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>100</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> individuals from a large population and recorded their flower color. They planted the snapdragons in an isolated area and returned after seven generations had passed. They randomly sampled <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> plants from the population and recorded their flower color. The results are shown in the table.

DISTRIBUTION OF SNAPDRAGON FLOWER COLOR PHENOTYPES

Time
 Number of Red (<math alttext="uppercase R uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow></math>) Snapdragons
 Number of Pink (<math alttext="uppercase R lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></math>) Snapdragons
 Number of White (<math alttext="lowercase r lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></math>) Snapdragons

At the start ofÂ study
 <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="43" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>43</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="23" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

After seven generations
 <math alttext="39" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="27" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The researchers performed a chi-square analysis to test their hypothesis.
content.question: Assuming the researchers use a significance level of <math alttext="0.05" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is closest to the critical value the researchers should use in the chi-square analysis?
